title: Anywhere Adventures is Hitting the Road!
content: We’re on the hunt for two U.S. communities to include in Vivian Li’s Innovator in Residence Project, Anywhere Adventures!  Visitors to the mobile experience are currently able to explore three American communities, Seattle, Chicago, and Southeastern Wyoming, through items from the Library’s digital collections and learn about the stories, people, and events that shaped everyday life in these place
creator: Isabel Brador
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Web Archiving at the Library After 25 Years
content: This post is co-written by Abbie Grotke, Amanda Lehman, and Melissa Wertheimer of the Web Archiving Section to close our 25th-anniversary celebration year with some highlights of the program.
creator: Melissa Wertheimer
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: What’s New Online at the Library of Congress: January 2026
content: In our first edition of "What’s New Online at the Library of Congress" of 2026, we share updates to the Library's digital collections, web archives, crowdsourced transcriptions, and historical newspapers from Washington, D.C. Click through to learn more!
creator: Carlyn Osborn
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Understanding AI at the Library: An Interview with Kurt Lemai-Nguyen
content: In this interview, 2025 Library of Congress Junior Fellow Kurt Lemai-Nguyen reflects on his experience working to support understanding AI at the Library in the Library's Digital Strategy Directorate. This interview has been edited for length and clarity.
creator: Leah Weinryb-Grohsgal
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: File Format Flair for the Holidays!  Updates to the Sustainability of Digital Formats
content: This post is part of the File Format Friends series and provides an overview of the updates to the Sustainability of Digital Formats site since June 2025. It discusses additions and updates to the MXF, PNG, and PDF formats, and new file format descriptions and analysis for YAML and APNG. The post also briefly covers planned work for the coming months.
creator: Liz Holdzkom
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Anywhere Adventures is Live!
content: This post is the third in a series about the Library’s 2025 Innovator in Residence, Vivian Li, and her project Anywhere Adventures. Following the selection of three communities, and a visit to the Library for research, the mobile experience has now officially launched!   The 2025 Innovator in Residence project, Anywhere Adventures, has officially launched!   The …
creator: Isabel Brador
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Expanding AI Community Engagement: An Interview with Noelia Alvarez
content: In this interview, 2025 Library of Congress Junior Fellow Noelia Alvarez reflects on her experience working on the Expanding AI Community Engagement Project in the Library's Digital Strategy Directorate.
creator: Leah Weinryb-Grohsgal
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Where Science Meets Storytelling: Twelve Years of the Science Blogs Web Archive
content: More than a decade after its launch, the Science Blogs Web Archive continues to grow and evolve. In this interview, Jennifer “JJ” Harbster reflects on building and maintaining the collection, while intern Yahir Brito brings a fresh perspective on updating and expanding it. Together, they share a few of their favorite blogs and discuss why it is important to preserve these unique examples of scient
creator: Tracee Haupt Fugate
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Putting the American Revolution in Context Through Transcription
content: What do patriotic songs, society women’s diaries, and nautical maps have in common? All give context to life in America before, during, and after the Revolutionary War - and you’re invited to transcribe them all with the By the People volunteer transcription program in commemoration of the 250th anniversary of American independence!
creator: Carlyn Osborn
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress

title: Artificial Intelligence Safety: An Interview with Stanford Research Fellow Duncan Eddy
content: In this interview, Stanford Research Fellow Dr. Duncan Eddy reflects on his professional background, shifting his focus on artificial intelligence safety standards, and what he is currently working on. He offers insightful observations from his work in AI safety and advice for future professionals. Dr. Eddy shared his experiences with the Library’s Artificial Intelligence Community …
creator: Leah Weinryb-Grohsgal
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress
